Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately show plants with water depicted as vibrant and healthy with green leaves and upright stems.
The student can illustrate plants without water showing signs of wilting or browning leaves, indicating they understand how water impacts plant health.
The student can effectively represent the idea that plants need water to live and grow by depicting water sources such as rain or a watering can.
The student can observe and illustrate patterns by drawing comparisons between plants that receive water and those that don't, with attention to detail in differences.
The student can demonstrate that living things, like plants, have needs such as water through labels or annotations in their drawing.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally struggle with minor elements, such as forgetting to label one part of the drawing, but this does not impact overall understanding. (student shows natural variation in attention to detail)

The student might attempt more advanced features, like showing soil dryness in plants without water, with mixed success, occasionally omitting or inaccurately depicting it. (student attempts but may not completely capture all nuances of plant environment)
